page.title: 01FARMLAND IN BRADFIELDS
page.content: This area is essentially arable farmland, owned privately with the exception of some council tenants on the southern fringe. Some farmers keep a few pigs and cattle for fattening, also sheep and poultry. There is little grassland except in the park at Bradfield Combust Hall (2) and at the stud for racing horses at Bradfield St. Clare Hall (4). Part of a large fruiti-farm protrudes into (1). there are four main rural residential areas: Hoggards Green (5), Great Green (12) and Bradfield St Clare (4) all contain come Council housing; Cross Green (10) has none. At Great Green there is now a dormitory housing estate of twenty five four-bedroomed modern house.
